title: Ok what the fuck.
body: I'm unranked, lvl 30, and I've been against diamonds and high elo players for so long. Why? This is my **_first_** NA account, and I am put against golds and diamonds since lvl 26? Why? Shouldn't I be against low elo players? I started playing LoL against like 2 months ago from a long break, made my first NA account, and I wake up to the surprise to be against diamonds. I'm not good enough to even play against golds, what can I do now to be against lower elos.

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=SupportTéémo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=A28X0kvB,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-11-09T23:44:58.777+0000)
>
> I&#039;m unranked, lvl 30, and I&#039;ve been against diamonds and high elo players for so long. Why? This is my **_first_** NA account, and I am put against golds and diamonds since lvl 26? Why? Shouldn&#039;t I be against low elo players? I started playing LoL against like 2 months ago from a long break, made my first NA account, and I wake up to the surprise to be against diamonds. I&#039;m not good enough to even play against golds, what can I do now to be against lower elos.

Don't bother with the riot response. you'll be fighting against shit odds for the rest of your league life.
Its because it's a new season, just wait a couple of weeks and you should be against your elo

It's not a new season just yet, but players around the same rating will still be matched together.  In both ranked and normals, matchmaking continues to adjust until it finds a spot best fit for you. 

Looking into this for you, it looks like you've been playing normal matches and borders are independent of that mode.  Since rating in normal is different from ranked, you might see players with different borders even though their normal rating might not reflect that.
